function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Influence of human mobility on spatial impact of interventions","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High mobility leading to increased spread of contagious diseases like malaria","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differences in movement patterns impacting regional spread of contagious diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Intervention in high-mobility areas can substantially reduce disease impact","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Differing sets of communities of strongly connected areas found in weighted networks of movements.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Stronger levels of internal connectivity through movements within the same communities.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Seasonal movement rates increase just before the main malaria transmission season, leading to potential spread of malaria.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spatial heterogeneities in movement patterns and predicted malaria risk lead to variations in relative rates of infection movements, contributing to malaria spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High movement rates drive parasite flows across the region, creating areas that are simultaneously both major sources and sinks of parasites.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Malaria risk mapping and prediction based on spatial covariates, vegetation amounts, and population density.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Analysis of population mobility patterns and trends in namibia, revealing shorter distance movements and increasing phone usage.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Human movement contributing to the spread of contagious diseases such as malaria.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High levels of movement within communities can lead to rapid transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Returning residents and visitors from risk areas can potentially carry infections to their home location or new destination, increasing the risk of disease spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Construction of a weighted network of movements between phone catchment areas","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Anonymized records of call and text message data were provided, but still contain potential identifying information.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Large volume of communications data from a significant portion of the adult population of namibia was collected.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Biases in the age distribution of mobile phone owners may affect the accuracy of the study’s findings and general estimates of human risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Using mobile phone call data records to analyze population movement","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of covariate
